intro: Phyllorkis crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting nectar-feeding insects. Phyllorkis crassifolia is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
